original: Hagström, Viktor Evald, läroverksadjunkt, Visby, f. 3/10/84 i Bara, Mailmöh. 1., av G. E. H. o. Jeanette Hagström. G. 33 m. fil. mag. Edla Johansson. Barn: Jan Gustaf Viktor o. Louise Gudrun Elisabeth ff. 36. — Mog:ex. i Kristianstad 04, fil. kand. i Gbg 20, fil. mag. 22, provår v. norra real i Sthlm 24. Res. t. HolL, Belg., Frankr., Ital. o. Tyskl. E. o. po,st-exp. 05, e. lär. i Söderköping 21-24, i Borås 25-26, vik. lektor i Umeå 26-27, vik. adj. i Linköping 27-29, Kalmar 29-30, Östersund 30-32 o. Visby 32, adj. i modersm., hist. m. samh :lära o. geogr. v. Visby h. a. k sed. 32. Skr.: En gammal medeltidsstad (22), En försvunnen medeltidsistad (23), Lof-qväden över Karl XII (32).
translated: Hagström, Viktor Evald, high school teacher, Visby, b. 3/10/84 in Bara, Malmöhus County, son of G. E. H. and Jeanette Hagström. Married in 1933 to Edla Johansson, who holds a degree in philosophy. Children: Jan Gustaf Viktor and Louise Gudrun Elisabeth, born in 1936. Divorced in Kristianstad in 1904, earned a bachelor's degree in Gothenburg in 1920, a master's degree in 1922, and spent a trial year at Norra Real in Stockholm in 1924. Traveled to Holland, Belgium, France, Italy, and Germany for study and work in 1905. Worked as a teacher in Söderköping from 1921-1924, in Borås from 1925-1926, as a substitute lecturer in Umeå in 1926-1927, a substitute teacher in Linköping in 1927-1929, Kalmar in 1929-1930, Östersund in 1930-1932, and Visby from 1932, where he teaches in Swedish, history, social science, and geography at Visby högre allmänna läroverk. Writings: "An Old Medieval City" (1922), "A Lost Medieval City" (1923), "Elegies for Charles XII" (1932).
